Text.Section:
ADVERSE REACTIONS
There have been rare reports of anaphylactic reactions following parenteral multivitamin administration. Rare reports of anaphylactoid reactions have also been reported after large intravenous doses of thiamine. The risk, however, is negligible if thiamine is coadministered with other vitamins in the B group. There have been no reports of fatal anaphylactoid reactions associated with M.V.I. Pediatric (r) .
There have been rare reports of the following types of reactions:
Dermatologic - rash, erythema, pruritus
CNS - headache, dizziness, agitation, anxiety
Ophthalmic -diplopia
Allergic - urticaria, shortness of breath, wheezing, and angioedema
